alert.note: Alert for Henry; Obion; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 20 at 2:14AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Tennessee, including the following areas, Benton TN, Carroll, Henry, Obion and Weakley. * WHEN...Until 11 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional heavy rainfall will be possible across areas that received very heavy rainfall during the early morning hours on Wednesday. Soil conditions are completely saturated and nearly all rainfall will be converted to runoff. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
